snippet: Frustrated by the pace of the investigation into the killing of Marco W. McMillian, a Mississippi mayoral candidate, his family is demanding that federal authorities step in.
abstract: Family of Marco W McMillian, gay mayoral candidate in Clarksdale, Miss, who was slain in Feb 2013, are demanding that federal authorities involve themselves in case; are joined by black and gay advocates in pressing Justice Dept for assistance because of frustration with slow pace of local investigation and because Mississippi's hate crimes statute does not cover sexual orientation.
lead_paragraph: Frustrated by the pace of the investigation into the killing of Marco W. McMillian, a Mississippi mayoral candidate, his family is demanding that federal authorities step in.

headline.seo: Family of Slain Mississippi Mayoral Candidate Seeks U.S. Inquiry
headline.main: Family of Slain Candidate Seeks Federal Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Family of Slain Candidate Seeks Federal Inquiry
